definitions.definition: To know , be aware of ( constructed with of when used intransitively ) .
examples: You committed terrible actions — to wit , murder and theft — and should be punished accordingly.
They are meddling in matters that men should not wit of.
definitions.label_groups: ambitransitive , obsolete except in to wit

main_definition: ( ambitransitive , obsolete except in to wit ) To know , be aware of ( constructed with of when used intransitively ) .
